pkgmetadata.longdescription:
The rock-dkms a package containing both the ROCK-Kernel-Driver and the latest firmware (which is not installed in this package). This package will build the kernel modules using the DKMS framework allowing for version agnostic compatibility meaning that you can compile this package against the latest point release of the long-term support kernel 5.4.x kernel series only (for security update reasons). The ROCk package has more GPU features like IPC related features (Memory sharing API, Signal sharing API); increasing GPU system memory limits from 3/8 of system memory to 29/32 of system memory; RDMA (aka Remote Device Programming or ROCmRDMA) to allow other PCIe kernel modules and devices DMA access to GPU memory, KFD (Kernel Fusion Driver) features, and DirectGMA (Direct Graphic Memory Access) support. ROCk is also a core component of the ROCm platform.
This amdgpu module contains extra kernel parameters compared to the vanilla amdgpu module that can be used to tune ROCk, SSG, power savings, memory usage. For details, do `modinfo amdgpu`.
It must look like:
ROCK_DKMS_KERNELS="5.2.17-pf 5.2.17-gentoo"
Use:
* to build all point releases Examples: 5.2.*-ot
^ to build only the highest point release Examples: 5.2.^-ot

use.flag: Checks if ACPI support is enabled in the kernel. Enabling ACPI may enhance multigpu detection with PowerXpress (multigpu laptops), provide more sysfs info, access to ACPI events for laptops, dynamic PCI-e frequency tuning.

Checks if the MMU_NOTIFIER is enabled.
Checks if the PCIe slots are supported.
Checks kernel config for DirectGMA support.
Pulls in the firmware package containing the latest firmware version.
Checks if kernel config for proper support for PowerXpress, Hybrid Graphics (i.e. IGP and dGPU on laptop).
